title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - Guinea

description.narrative: The Banking team advisors are providing intermittent technical assistance to the Central Bank in the following areas: Assisting with the implementation phase of Guineas National Strategy for Financial Inclusion; Providing assistance with the development of a comprehensive e-money issuer (EMI) regulatory framework, including improving the current EMI regulation, developing licensing guidelines, and implementing supervisory policies and procedures; Designing an automated reporting framework for the collection and analysis of data from non-bank financial institutions, including EMIs and microfinance institutions; Assisting the BCRG with the further modernization of the payments system to allow for and interoperability among banks as well as greater participation by non-bank financial institutions;Assisting the BCRG with strengthening supervision of the microfinance sector; and Enabling MSMEs access to credit by: Drafting and adopting new laws for Secured Transactions, Factoring, and Leasing. Designing, Creating, and Launching a Registry of Moveable Assets

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - Guinea

description.narrative: The advisors are assisting the Central Bank of the Republic of Guinea (BCRG) with developing and maintaining a fair, safe, and stable financial sector that benefits and protects financial sector participants while enhancing public confidence in the banking system and supporting inclusive private sector-led economic growth. Project activities are focused on: 1) building the BCRGs capacity to adequately regulate and supervise Guinean EMIs and their agents; 2) establishing a deposit insurance system that protects depositors in the case of financial institution failures and maintains public confidence in the financial sector; 3) developing and implementing an effective resolution framework that allows for the orderly resolution of failed financial institutions; 4) developing a framework for secured transactions that allows small borrowers and MSMEs to secure credit using their moveable property as collateral, which will support increased access to credit; and 5) developing the tools needed to monitor and evaluate progress in increasing financial inclusion.
